      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        g - - The Systems Graphics object

        Override the frames Paint method, draw the backBuffer and sync with the system The purpose of this is to solve any strange rendering glitches, doing it this way allows for an image to be designed in the background and then brought forward all at once.

      • setKeyChar

        public void setKeyChar(char keyChar)
        Set the current key being pressed to the currentChar variable The purpose of this if for typeing on screen. Once the keycode's char is passed in, that currentChar variable can be accessed at that time for typing, instead of accessing hundreds of keycodes and chars.
        Parameters:
        keyChar - - A char of what is being pressed down

      • calcAngleMoveY

        protected double calcAngleMoveY(double angle)

      • updateSprites

        protected void updateSprites()

      • spriteCollision

        protected void spriteCollision()
        Detect when a sprite intersects a sprite and call a handling method currently only rectangles are used for detection.

        spr1 - The first sprite (Most of the time the player) spr2 - The second sprite (Most of the time a random npc or enemy) hitDir - The bound which is being intersected on spr1 hitDir2 - The bound which is being intersected on spr2

      • tileCollision

        public boolean tileCollision()
        Same as the above spriteCollision() method but instead the collision is between a sprite and a Tile. Also, currently only with rectangles.

        The method gets a sprite and then gets each tile, if either objects intersects any bounds made for either object the method calls a handling method for dealing with very specific properties that are relative to each game
